results.title: The Albatross
results.brief_description: This claymation tells the story of a lone desert dweller. The ‘humanoid’ animal one day comes across an injured albatross and sets about to nurture the bird back to health. Later in her explorations of the day she comes across a caged and abandoned male counterpart and proceeds to help him also. On contact with the male she telepathically sees the mans troubled past (the cause of his present condition) and responds with empathy and friendship.

results.title: The Alamo (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Wayne, United Artists Corporation, Batjac Productions and The Alamo Company
results.brief_description: Filming “The Alamo” fulfilled a long-time dream for John Wayne who not only starred as the legendary Davy Crockett, but also produced and directed this sprawling epic western about Texas’ fight for independence. An impressive cast features Richard Widmark (Jim Bowie), Laurence Harvey (Colonel Travis) and Richard Boone (Sam Housten). The battle sequences of the final attack are a truly memorable spectacle in the depiction of this pivotal event in American history when, in 1836, 185 “Texans” held off an army of 7000 Mexican troops to secure the independence of the State. This epic masterpiece earned seven Academy Award nominations including Best Picture. A haunting musical score by Dimitri Tiomkin and co-starring Frankie Avalon.

results.title: The Airport
results.brief_description: Bridget Robertson goes to the airport to collect her sister’s body. She reflects on Tina’s life, cut short at 25 in a motor bike accident.

results.title: The Air-conditioning
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
The problem of global warming has preoccupied scientists, meteorologists and environmentalists since it was considered a threat to our existence. Artificial satellites have helped provide a clearer picture. However, if more reliable forecasting shows that some countries can expect to benefit from the warming of the planet, will those countries want to prevent human impact on the climate of Spaceship Earth?

results.title: The Aims of irrigation
results.brief_description: The film outlines briefly the three aims of controlled irrigation: to supply the water requirements of the growing crop; to use water efficiently; to avoid soil damage. It stresses that the achievement of these amis should be the constant endeavour of every irrigation farmer so as to maintain soil fertility, and to obtain the maximum return for their labour.

results.title: The AIF's Great Route March : Review No 460
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
This Cinesound newsreel consists of footage of the AIF’s Great Route March - a training march across the Blue Mountains to Bathurst which took twelve days over one hundred and thirty miles.

results.title: The AIDS movie
results.brief_description: This film speaks simply and forcefully to students, It features Paul, Sunnye and Susan, three people with the AIDS disease, who share what it’s like to live with it and how to protect yourself against it. AIDS educator, David Brumbach, speaks on the importance of awareness and prevention.

results.title: The Aid trap. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Bryer, Derek Jones, Judith Weymont and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Wealthy western nations in more recent times, have given aid to poorer nations struck by disasters such as famine, flood and war. The primary purpose of aid is to strengthen a political relationship between allies. Both parts of the video compare situations in Kerala and Bangladesh in terms of food distibution and programmes to prevent problems caused by overpopulation. At the time of production, food distribution in Bangladesh was hampered by corrupt political infra-structures in some areas, while education was not a high priority. In Kerala the effects of sound educational programmes and a fairer distribution of resources was examined.

results.title: The Agrarian revolution
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the enclosure of common lands, one of the most dramatic happenings in British history, and describes the changes in agriculture over the last two hundred and fifty years. Commentary by spoken by Dick Graham.
